did.abstract: Reports of the Eight Hour Commission, which was appointed by the US President to observe the effects of instituting an eight hour standard workday.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Eight Hour Commission was comprised of three appointees of the US President to to observe and report on the effects of the eight hour workday. The Commission was established by the US Senate in September 191.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Reports of the Eight Hour Commission from 1918, as well as a 1943 reproduction of a report from 1917.
